answers.answer: u could have looked it up, so why did u notu could have asked dr, so why did u nothere is a thumbnail description; from wikipediaGastroparesis, also called delayed gastric emptying, is a medical condition consisting of a paresis (partial paralysis) of the stomach, resulting in food remaining in the stomach for a longer period of time than normal. Normally, the stomach contracts to move food down into the small intestine for digestion. The vagus nerve controls these contractions. Gastroparesis may occur when the vagus nerve is damaged and the muscles of the stomach and intestines do not work normally. Food then moves slowly or stops moving through the digestive tract.DO U have ailments that r chronic like Diabetes or other auto immune diseases?good luck
Gastoporisis is when the muscles in your stomack or passageway is damaged or blocked causing slow digestion of food to small intestine
No, no other immune dieases or diabetes.Thank you for your answer.

question: I was diagnosed yesterday with gastroperesis, I have a followup in two weeks for an ultrasound of the abdomen/pelvic.  I don't know what gastroperesis is or what causes it.
